description: From Old French asseurer (Modern French assurer), from Latin ad- + securus (“secure”). Cognate with Spanish asegurar. Doublet of assecure.

verbs.description: assure (third-person singular simple present assures, present participle assuring, simple past and past participle assured)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make sure and secure; ensure.
(transitive, followed by that or of) To give (someone) confidence in the trustworthiness of (something).
examples: I assure you that the program will work smoothly when we demonstrate it to the client.
He assured of his commitment to her happiness.
